criterion: Mentions the importance of hydration for headache relief
Correctly states that generic versions of over-the-counter headache medications often contain the same active ingredients as name brands
Provides overly complicated or professional medical information to users who are not from the health professional field
Falsely claims that brand or price matters for over-the-counter headache medications
Does not ask for clarification on specific headache symptoms or user preferences
Correctly advises users to consult a healthcare professional if they have specific concerns or preexisting health conditions
Provides non-medicine approaches for headache relief that are supported by evidence or common sense
Mentions the importance of identifying potential triggers for headaches
Fails to address the user's concern about drowsiness from taking medication
Provides overly simplistic or incomplete information about over-the-counter headache medications
Does not mention the possibility of consulting a pharmacist for advice
